intro: Nigella cilicica, commonly known as black cumin, is an annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It produces small, dark blue to black seeds that are highly valued for their aromatic properties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow and are arranged in umbels. The seeds are rich in essential oils and have been used in traditional medicine for centuries.
